questionText: What is the purpose of the iota::clock::Clock module?

answerOptions.answerText: To provide a mutable timestamp for transactions
To give access to a near-real-time immutable timestamp

questionText: How often does the timestamp provided by the Clock module change?

answerOptions.answerText: Only when a new block is added

questionText: Which function provides the timestamp for the start of the current epoch?
What must be true for a transaction to use the Clock module?

answerOptions.answerText: It must be passed as a mutable reference
It must be passed as an immutable reference
It must be passed as a value
It must be created within the transaction
